p: Ten of the twelve diatom taxa exhibited strong negative correlations between the percentage north of an isotherm and that isotherm position in periods of both warming and cooling ( Table 1a), Ditylum brightwellii and Skeletonema costatum being the two diatom species not exhibiting such evidence of a plastic environmental niche. Only one of the diatom taxa, Rhizosolenia styliformis, exhibited a significant negative correlation between population size and mean SST (two others exhibited positive correlations, Table 1c, Supplementary Table 2a). The general observation is that diatoms appear able to adapt to SST changes and those SST changes do not negatively affect their abundance.
